content.description: Start on two smallish pockets in the middle of the wall. Pull hard to gain a jug, pull a few moves and top out. Many variations exist on this boulder, and it has some cool features. The rock quality is not to the standard of the other boulders in the area.
content.location: Directly behind the BFB. If you are at the Sharks Fin (at the very top of the notch, where it is narrowest) walk accros the street and look left. The boulder looks a little chossy (and is) but it has some cool problems on it.

content.description: Semi sit-start using a sharp two finger quartz pocket. Go up to some larger holds, pick some more handhold's (there are many, some better than others) and topout. Interesting holds, poor rock.
content.location: Directly behind the BFB. If you are at the Sharks Fin (at the very top of the notch, where it is narrowest) walk accros the street and look left. The boulder looks a little chossy (and is) but it has some cool problems on it.

content.description: Chossy looking, sharp rock that is still occasionally worth climbing.
